sanskrit_verse:
रेतःसेकः स्वयोनीषु कुमारीष्वन्त्यजासु च ।
सख्युः पुत्रस्य च स्त्रीषु गुरुतल्पसमं विदुः ॥ ११.५८॥
transliteration:
retaḥsekaḥ svayonīṣu kumārīṣv antyajāsu ca |
sakhyuḥ putrasya ca strīṣu gurutalpasamaṃ viduḥ || 11.58||
sph_interpretive_translation: The act of depositing semen in the womb of a maiden, outcaste woman, or wife of a friend or son is known to be equivalent to violating the bed of one's guru.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from the purity and integrity of relational dharmic structures.
Causation arises through violation of sacred boundaries that uphold cosmic order.
Capacity-based responsibility requires recognition of the spiritual elevation of relationships.
Restoration logic demands purification and re-alignment with the violated dharma field.
Consciousness alignment necessitates acknowledgment of transgression at the level of intent and energetic contamination.
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual deposits semen in a prohibited relational vessel THEN initiate consciousness restoration protocol.
IF violation occurs within sacred trust domains THEN assign completion process aligned with guru-talpa equivalence.
IF transgressor demonstrates capacity for energetic purification THEN enable reintegration via nyaya-based ritual reset.
IF societal harmony depends on rectifying breach THEN execute non-punitive public realignment without shame enforcement.
supreme_court_application: In adjudication at the highest levels, this principle establishes threshold violations based on relational sanctity rather than physical harm. The court must assess not just action but ontological disruption caused by the breach of dharma-coded intimacy. Responsibility is determined by proximity to sacred roles (e.g., guru), regardless of formal titles. Restoration precedes judgment; punitive measures are invalid.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that causality lies in the distortion of energetic fields tied to sacred relationships. Anupūrvaśaḥ traces the sequential degradation of consciousness resulting from such acts. Proportional responsibility aligns with the gravity of violating guru-equivalent reverence. Non-punitive reality rule confirms that suffering cannot restore balance—only conscious completion and energetic cleansing can.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Vedic ritual purification (prayascitta) under qualified guidance to cleanse energetic contamination.
Assign transgressor completion tasks involving service to those representing violated dharmic roles.
Facilitate guided meditation and mantra practices aimed at restoring inner purity and relational awareness.
Establish temporary separation from community until integrity reassessment confirms readiness for reintegration.
final_declaration: This law proceeds solely from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Justice herein serves only restoration, never punishment. Dharma stands restored when consciousness realigns with its source. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone is the ultimate judge.
